title: Chip and Joanna Gaines are opening a hotel in Waco, Texas
text:
Chip and Joanna Gaines are opening their first hotel in downtown Waco, Texas.

The Fixer Upper couple announced in a new video on their website today that they've partnered with AJ Capital on their first-ever hotel, which will be just a few blocks away from their Magnolia Market at the Silos.

Chip, 44, and Joanna, 41, excited shared the news with fans, and offered a sneak peak at what the space will look like.

Scroll down for video

Coming soon! Chip and Joanna Gaines are opening their first hotel in downtown Waco, Texas

The future: They shared a rendering of the hotel, which so far does not have a name

Where they're starting: The couple is making over the historic Grand Karem Shrine, a three-story, 53,000-square-foot space built in 1928

Ta-da! They've partnered with AJ Capital on the project, their first-ever hotel

Throwbacks: Much of the structure remains unchanged, and it still features decorative symbols of Freemasons and Shriners

'We are excited, we finally get to share some news with you,' Joanna says in the clip.

After a quick outfit change, Chip comes back dressed as an over-eager bellhop, and the two erupt into giggles.

'Y'all, we're gonna have a hotel in downtown Waco, Texas,' Chip says.

'We are ready to get started on this iconic building downtown a few blocks away from the Silos,' adds Joanna.

The couple is making over the historic Grand Karem Shrine, a three-story, 53,000-square-foot space built in 1928.

According to Architectural Digest, much of the structure remains unchanged, and it still features decorative symbols of Freemasons and Shriners.

The couple plans to keep much of the structure — including the ballroom — as-is when it opens the hotel in 2021. They'll begin renovations this fall and promise to keep fans updated on their progress.

Dressed for the occasion! The couple announced the news with a cute video today

'It's gonna be a big project, but we cannot wait to restore it back to its former glory. There's so many details about this building that are gorgeous,' said Joanna

Coming soon: There will also be a rooftop terrace, a ground-floor restaurant, and a café

'Home is a feeling, created by and for the people you love and share your life with; it’s a state of being known and loved just as you are,' the couple added in a joint statement

Inside: The couple plans to keep much of the structure — including the ballroom — as-is when it opens the hotel

Starting soon! They are set to start working on the hotel this fall and will keep fans updated

Wow! It is sure to be a big project for the couple, but they are excited

'It's gonna be a big project, but we cannot wait to restore it back to its former glory. There's so many details about this building that are gorgeous,' says Joanna.

There will also be a rooftop terrace, a ground-floor restaurant, and a café.

'If you’ve followed our work, you might notice a pattern — that time and time again, Chip and I are drawn to projects that emphasize the value of home,' Joanna wrote on their blog.

'When a project like the one we’re announcing today comes along, and it bridges what we’re most passionate about — home, hospitality, and restoration — we can’t help but go all-in. '

'Home is a feeling, created by and for the people you love and share your life with; it’s a state of being known and loved just as you are,' the couple added in a joint statement.

'That is our dream for this hotel — that it would serve as an extension of the way we feel about our own home and all it represents to us, and that every guest who comes to stay would experience that same sense of belonging and community.'

Expanding! The couple already own the B&B Magnolia House in McGregor, Texas, which they made over on their show Fixer Upper

On TV: Chip and Joanna worked on the 2,868-square-foot 1880s farmhouse on their show and opened it in 2016

So popular! It quickly booked up for the first six months

Decked out! Amenities include free WiFi, Keurig coffee machines, high-end toiletries, a washer and dryer, local guide books, umbrellas, charger cables, and board games

Get cookin'! There is also a full kitchen with appliances, pots, and pans

'Reviving timeless, historical buildings is at the core of what we do,' Ben Weprin, founder and CEO of Adventurous Journeys Capital Partners, added.

'We are excited to partner with Chip, Joanna, and the Magnolia team to bring an authentic hotel experience to the growing and lively community of Waco.'

Though this is the first hotel for the Gainses, they already have several businesses including the Magnolia House B&B in McGregor, Texas.

Chip and Joanna worked on the 2,868-square-foot 1880s farmhouse on their show and opened it in 2016 — when it quickly booked up for the first six months.

Amenities include free WiFi, Keurig coffee machines, high-end toiletries, bottled water, bath robes, a washer and dryer, laundry detergent, a sewing kit, local guide books, umbrellas, charger cables, board games, a Bluetooth speaker, a full kitchen, and more, according to Country Living.

The couple's new hotel is bound to be equally well-outfitted — and is also likely to book up fast once reservations become available.
description: Chip, 44, and Joanna, 41, shared the news online today. They'll begin renovations on the Grand Karem Shrine this fall. They've partnered with AJ Capital on the space, which will open in 2021.
